job.title: Data Scientist
job.description: SummaryAs a Data Scientist at Fast, you will partner closely with product managers, engineering, design, marketing, sales, or other operational leaders to define core metrics/KPIs, generate actionable data insights from large datasets, build automated dashboards using data pipelines, and run experiments to measure impact of new initiatives. RoleRun complex data queries, analyze large datasets and run statistical analyses to continuously drive deeper understanding of our customers and product performanceCreate dashboards and reports with effective data visualizationsBe a thought partner to business leaders in determining quantitative success and process improvementBuild data pipelines and create scripts to automate processes and reportsBuild models to improve our understanding of user behavior and predict future performance Requirements3+ years of experience in quantitative analysis rolesFluent in SQL and a scripting language (R, Python)Knowledge of experimentation and statistical methodsBS in quantitative field or equivalent experienceSkilled with Looker, Jupyter Notebook and other data visualization toolsNice to Have5+ years of experience in quantitative analysis rolesAdvanced degree in quantitative field or equivalent experienceKnowledge of building data pipelines (e.g. dbt, airflow)Experience in e-commerce industryPrevious mature startup experience
